intro: Geostachys belumensis, commonly known as the Bornean geostachys, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems, typical of many tropical shrubs. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are often white or pale pink. Geostachys belumensis plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat by providing food and shelter for various insects and small animals.
